abstract.p: In response to their petition (ʿarzdasht), the landlord (chaudhri) Purshottam Das and the record-keeper (qanungo) Paras Ram of district (pargana) Dhar are informed that the police officials Abdul Hamid and Khuda Dost have been instructed to remove their soldiers from the villages. Additionally, Purshottam Das and Paras Ram are told to send certain dues, having already been forgiven a large amount of rupees.

div.p:
زبده الاماثل و الاعیان پرسوتمداس چودری و پرسرام قانونگوی پرگنه دهار
را انهاء آنکه عرضه داشتی که دراینولا در باب بر طرف شدن دهات شحنگی
عبد الحمید نوشته ارسال داشته بودند رسید بعبد الحمید و خدا دوست نگاشته اند که
برسیدن نوشته پیادهای خود را از دهات مذکور بردارند یقین که بزودی پیادها
را ازاینجا برطرف خواهد نمود باید که ازینممری خاطر خود را جمعداشته در
تردد ابادانی و کشتکار زراعت خود را معاف ندارند و در یکساعت
برای رضامندی شما هست سه ٣ هزار روپیه را معاف نموده شد عجب که شما جزوی ما را نمی فرستید الحال لایق انکه بزودی زر اینجانب را ارسال دارید و پاره در رضاجوی ما سعی نماید
زیاده چه نوشته
بیضThis line of text is written up the left margin. Unusually, the scribe has written a 'pesh' above the baiz.
۲۰ جمادیThe date is written in the top left corner and due to damage is incomplete.

Eminent among Equals and among Nobles Purshottam Das chaudhri and Paras Ram qanungo of pargana Dhar
are informed that the ʿarzdasht which recently had been written and sent about the matter of the setting aside of the villages [by the] police [officer]
Abdul Hamid has arrived. To Abdul Hamid and Khuda Dost it has been written that
on the arrival of the writing [instructions], they should remove their soldiers from the said villages. Surely, the soldiers
will be removed from here immediately. It is necessary that in this matter [Purshottam Das and Paras Ram] settle their minds and
not take themselves as exempt from populating [the area] and managing agriculture. At the same time,
to please you,Unusually, here the writer addresses Purshottam Das and Paras Ram directly, using the second-person subject "shoma." 3000 rupees have been forgiven. It is strange that you are not sending a part of my [dues]. Now it is suitable that you send the money here quickly and that you make a little effort to please me. What more [should be] written? Ended.
[On] 20 JumadaBecause the edge of the page is tattered, the date is incomplete. The date range ascribed to the document has been estimated based on the years Asadullah and Nawazish Khan are known to have been active in the area based on other documents in this collection.

بموجب که شما نوشته بودید مقرر شد
قوی با قوت است رعایا را
خاطر جمع سازید الله الله خاطر خود را
جمع سازید انچه نگارد بیض

That for which you had written has been settled.
The strong are with strength.
Settle the minds of the peasants and [by] God
settle your own minds, and so it should be written. Ended.

زر ما را بزودی حواله منتخب ما را نمایند که
بفرستند الله الله اینقدر زر چه خواهد بود
رعایت ما مسطور
عجزی آن است
انچه نگارد بیض
اسد الله مرید اخلاص نوازش خانی

Entrust my money, with speed, to the person selected by me so that
he can send it. [By] God, what use is such money?
My opinion as written will be the cure [of this problem].
So should be written. Ended.
Round black ink sealAsadullah, sincere disciple of Nawazish KhanThis seal, which belonged to Asadullah, the deputy of the noble Nawazish Khan, also appears in the document with shelfmark LNS 235 MS l1 from 1660.
